channel.title: Trading problem
channel.description: how do i make trading dont work for admins that can spawn? im new to java

item.title: Trading problem
item.dc:creator: @King_Lingerz King Lingerz
item.description:
@King_Lingerz wrote:

djdoyle1:

Cmon guys! Not delta!!!

I don’t and never will use Delta.

I created that code using methods from my server, looked at the Delta methods and changed mine to Delta’s.

Don’t just assume next time.

djdoyle1:

Cmon guys danny 508! Not delta!!!

Thanks.

@Topic: Danny, you need to learn to do things yourself. This is about as simple as it gets, and I’ve already told/taught you how to use ‘if’ statements, that’s all that’s required for this.

Read full topic

item.title: Trading problem
item.dc:creator: @123kdd100 123kdd100
item.description:
@123kdd100 wrote:

[quote=“djdoyle1, post:10, topic:313382”][quote author=King Lingerz link=topic=409885.msg3025068#msg3025068 date=1257872372]

i want player rights 3 not beable to trade what do i change?

Don’t you have any idea what you are doing?

Learn to use a simple ‘if’ statement…

EXAMPLE:

if (playerRights < 3) { sM("Add the trading here."); } else { sM("You cannot trade as your player rights are too high."); }

What that basically does is if the players rights are below three, say ‘Add the trading here.’. Else, it will say ‘You cannot trade as your player rights are too high.’.

So just edit your method, obviously adding the above, and it will stop anyone playerRights three or above from trading.
[/quote][quote author=123kdd100 link=topic=409885.msg3025173#msg3025173 date=1257877878]

how do i make trading dont work for admins that can spawn? im new to java

easy, search administrators cannot trade or something.
delete the public void.
done!
[/quote][quote author=King Lingerz link=topic=409885.msg3025068#msg3025068 date=1257872372]

i want player rights 3 not beable to trade what do i change?

Don’t you have any idea what you are doing?

Learn to use a simple ‘if’ statement…

EXAMPLE:

if (playerRights < 3) { sM("Add the trading here."); } else { sM("You cannot trade as your player rights are too high."); }

What that basically does is if the players rights are below three, say ‘Add the trading here.’. Else, it will say ‘You cannot trade as your player rights are too high.’.

So just edit your method, obviously adding the above, and it will stop anyone playerRights three or above from trading.
[/quote]

Cmon guys! Not delta!!![/quote]
no offence
this has nothing to do with delta -.-

Read full topic

item.title: Trading problem
item.dc:creator: @King_Lingerz King Lingerz
item.description:
@King_Lingerz wrote:

danny 508:

i want player rights 3 not beable to trade what do i change?

Don’t you have any idea what you are doing?

Learn to use a simple ‘if’ statement…

EXAMPLE:

if (playerRights < 3) { sM("Add the trading here."); } else { sM("You cannot trade as your player rights are too high."); }

What that basically does is if the players rights are below three, say ‘Add the trading here.’. Else, it will say ‘You cannot trade as your player rights are too high.’.

So just edit your method, obviously adding the above, and it will stop anyone playerRights three or above from trading.

Read full topic

item.title: Trading problem
item.dc:creator: @danny_508 danny 508
item.description:
@danny_508 wrote:

public void tradeReq(int id) {
	if (!server.trading) {
		sM("Trading has been temporarily disabled");
		return;
	}
	client other = (client) handler.players[id];
	if (validClient(trade_reqId)) {
		if (other.inTrade) {
			sM("Other player is busy at the moment.");
			trade_reqId = 0;
			return;
		}
	}

if(other.interfaceOpened){
int EnemyX = PlayerHandler.players[trade_reqId].absX;
int EnemyY = PlayerHandler.players[trade_reqId].absY;
TurnPlayerTo(EnemyX, EnemyY);
sM(“Other player is busy at the moment.”);
return;
}
if(action == 1){
return;
}
if(other.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerName)){
sM(“Other player is busy at the moment.”);
return;
}
if(other.action == 1){
return;
}

	if (validClient(trade_reqId) && !inTrade && other.tradeRequested
			&& (other.trade_reqId == playerId)) {
		openTrade();
		other.openTrade();
int EnemyX = PlayerHandler.players[trade_reqId].absX;
int EnemyY = PlayerHandler.players[trade_reqId].absY;
TurnPlayerTo(EnemyX, EnemyY);
	} else if (validClient(trade_reqId) && !inTrade
			&& (System.currentTimeMillis() - lastButton > 1000)) {
		lastButton = System.currentTimeMillis();
		tradeRequested = true;
		trade_reqId = id;
int EnemyX = PlayerHandler.players[trade_reqId].absX;
int EnemyY = PlayerHandler.players[trade_reqId].absY;
TurnPlayerTo(EnemyX, EnemyY);
		sM("Sending trade request...");
		other.sM(playerName + ":tradereq:");
	}
}

public void specialAtk(boolean hitTwice, int specDrain, int projectileHit, int emoteSet) {
client AttackingOn2 = (client) server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn];
int EnemyX = PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absX;
int EnemyY = PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absY;
if(isInWilderness(EnemyX, EnemyY, 1) == false){
return;
}

i want player rights 3 not beable to trade what do i change?

item.dc:creator: @Oh-Noes Oh-Noes
item.description:
@Oh-Noes wrote:

First find where your trading method and post it here. Best way to find it is to search for:

Sending trade request...

in your client.java and post the entire void - its probably called something like public void tradeReq.
